newsitem.title: SINGAPORE: Singapore rubber futures close lower across board.
newsitem.headline: Singapore rubber futures close lower across board.

text.p: Singapore rubber futures closed lower across the board on some late local selling interest in line with lower Japanese prices, brokers said on Wednesday.
They said prices in Tokyo and Kobe were also lower across the board, pressured by scattered profit-taking after recent rises. But market focus is on the spot expiry next Monday.

"The morning session was quiet and featureless except for some trade in the RSS3 contract. But prices were marked down across the board in the afternoon on selling interest in sympathy with weaker Japanese prices. Volume was moderate," a local dealer said.
"There was hardly any trade in the morning but prices fell...in the afternoon in line with lower prices in Tokyo and Kobe," another broker said.
At around 0945 GMT, December RSS3 was down half a cent to 126.50 U.S. cents a kg.
April/June RSS1 was off half a cent to 189.50 Singapore cents (US$1.35) a kg.
April/June TSR20 fell 0.75 cent to 181.25 Singapore cents (US$1.29) a kg.
